ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: In the course, we cover major works of HCS. We also learn about various logics of inquiry that structure HCS. I would recommend it. It was a great place to gain a broad understanding of the subfield. The works we read are fundamental and it is more helpful to read as part of a group. It was also helpful as a refresher on logics of inquiry. It is always fruitful to return to the basics of social science research.
I would definitely recommend it to anyone interested in reading the classic in comparative historical sociology and understanding the basics of the subfield.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course provided me with a basic understanding of major arguments and logics of inquiry in HCS. This is very helpful and directly relevant to the degree requirement of the field exam.
